text: 1. CALL TO ORDER/FLAG SALUTE
2. COMMUNICATION – EMPLOYEE ORGANIZATIONS
3. PRESENTATION
Cupertino Union School District Toyokawa Sister City Delegation
4. PUBLIC COMMENTS
The public may address the Board on any agenda item and any item not on the agenda.  The Board
president will only call on those who have filled out comment cards before the meeting, and each speaker
will be allotted three (3) minutes.  The Board will not respond or take action on any non-agenda item
comments at this time, although the item may be agendized at a later date (Ed. Code 35145.5).  The
comments shall be made from the podium.  In accordance with Government Code 54954.2 – No action or
discussion shall be undertaken on any item not appearing on the posted agenda.  The Board shall limit the
total time to 30 minutes.
5. CONSENT ITEMS
Consent items are considered to be routine by the Board of Education and will be enacted in one
motion.  If discussion of any of the items is required, they may be removed from Consent and
considered separately.
5.1     Ratification of the Personnel Report for August 2014
5.2     Approval of Five Year Contract with Tyco Integrated Security for Monitoring, Inspection
and Device Testing of Fire Alarm Systems at 28 District sites
5.3     Approval of Bid Award for Purchase of Synergy Student Information System from Edupoint
and Versifit
5.4     Approval of the School Site Grants - PTA/PTO/Foundation Grants
Board Meeting Agenda August 19, 2014 Page 2
5.5     Ratification of a Contract Agreement with Linda Denman for Administrator Coaching
Services for the 2014-2015 School Year
5.6     Ratification of a Contract Agreement with Vivian Gruener for Kindergarten through Third
Grade Music Instruction at Blue Hills and Stocklmeir Elementary Schools for the
5.7     Award of Architectural Services
5.8     Purchase of One Modular Classroom for Kennedy Middle School
5.9     Approve an Agreement with Orbach, Huff & Suarez, LLP for Legal Representation and
Consulting Services
5.10   Approval of August 15, 2014 Revisions to the Measure H Bond Program Project List
5.11   Approval of Contract to HMC Architects for Assistance with School Site Acquisition
6.  SUPERINTENDENT’S REPORT
7.  ACTION ITEM
7.1    Second Reading and Adoption of Board Policies – Updates and Additions
8.  DISCUSSION/INFORMATION ITEMS
8.1    Accept for Information the Quarterly Report on Williams Uniform Complaints
8.2    Common Core State Standards (CCSS) Aligned K-5 Report Card - Phase I and Phase II
8.3    Discussion of CSBA Recommended Resolution on Local Reserves Cap
9.  BOARD ACTIVITY
10.  ADJOURNMENT
